result.execSummary:
The defendant Parnell D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA surcharge is waived.  In lieu of payment of court costs, defendant to serve 4 days jail.  Apply 4 days sentence credit.  COSTS ARE DEEMED PAID IN FULL.

Straigh Time.
Apply 60 days sentence credit.
TIME SERVED.

Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Parnell D Brown in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Paul Bugenhagen. 
Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters an Alfred No Contest plea to the amended count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended count 1.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail
60 Days Credit
Time Served.

Costs: $243
DNA Surcharge:  Waived
Payment Forthwith - In Lieu of Payment -  4 Days in the Waukesha County Jail -  4 Day Credit
Paid in full.

Order Denying Defense Motion for Bail Modification.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 09/04/14.

Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Parnell D Brown in court with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.  
Motion filed by Atty. Bugenhagen - Bail Modification.

Defense still waiting on discovery request.

Atty. Bugenhagen presented arguments to the court.
Requesting the Cash Bail be modified to a Signature Bond.
State objects to any bail modification and presented arguments to the court.

Court Denies - Bail Modification.
Bail and conditions remains as previously fixed.
Motion hearing on September 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
for modification of bail filed by Attorney Bugenhagen.
Status conference on September 4, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Parnell D Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Strubbe from the City of Delafield was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. Recross by both sides. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects to bind over and presents arguments.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Bugenhagen directed to go to the clerks office to get his next court date in Br. 5 due to the Speedy Trial Demand being made.   Defense counsel presents bail motion arguments. State objects to any modification. Court denied the motion. Bail remains as fixed.
for modification of bail filed by Attorney Bugenhagen.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
